question: Will at least 50% of U.S. COVID-19 cases be from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022?
description:
This will resolve to "Yes" if, according to the CDC, the share of the Omicron (B.1.1.529) variant has 50.00% or more proportion of SARS-CoV-2 circulating variants in the USA for the week ending on January 1, 2022. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The market will be resolved on the CDC's Nowcast model that estimates more recent proportions of circulating variants. The week bar which ends on January 1, 2022 will be clicked, and the % TOTAL column in the table which refers to the Omicron variant will used for the resolution of this market. If the data moves or changes, or the link changes, these new changes and/or link which delineate % TOTAL will be used. 

The market will resolve as soon as the CDC publishes the Nowcast estimates for the week ending January 1, 2022 - which is scheduled for January 4th. Data will be checked at 8:00 PM ET, January 4, 2022, and every day subsequently if data is not available. 

If data is not available for the week ending on January 1, 2022 by January 10, 2022, the market will resolve based on the most recent weekly data before January 1, 2022. 

-------------------------------

Please note, Nowcast does not predict future spread of the virus nor it provides exact current data, but it does help estimate current prevalence of variants, based on genomic surveillance data from previous weeks. Estimates of variant proportions for previous weeks may change as more data are reported. Nowcast estimates consistently align with the weighted proportions based on reported sequencing data, which are published 2-3 weeks later.

To identify and track SARS-CoV-2 variants, CDC uses genomic surveillance. 

The CDC provides weekly Nowcast estimates which are updated every week on Tuesday.

events.title: What percent of US COVID-19 cases will be from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022?
events.description: This is a market group on the percent of US COVID-19 cases originating from the Omicron variant on January 1, 2022, according to CDC's nowcast https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#variant-proportions.

question: NBA: Will the Pistons beat the Thunder by more than 4.5 points in their December 6 matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for December 6:

If the Detroit Pistons win by over 4.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Oklahoma City Thunder lose by less than 4.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by December 13, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: World Chess Championship 2021: Will Ian Nepomniachtchi win a game?
description:
The World Chess Championship 2021 is an ongoing chess match between reigning world champion Magnus Carlsen and challenger Ian Nepomniachtchi to determine the World Chess Champion. 

The full match consists of maximum 14 regular games, and a score of 7½ wins the world championship. If the score is equal after 14 games, tie-break games with faster time controls will be played. Any potential tie-break games will not be considered for this market, only the regular games (14 maximum) will be considered. 

At the time of the market's inception (December 6, 11 AM ET), there were 8 regular games completed so far, 6 of them ended with a draw, 2 of them were won by Carlsen.

If Ian Nepomniachtchi wins any of the upcoming regular games, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

------------------------------

WCC 2021 is held under the auspices of FIDE, the world chess federation, and played at Dubai Exhibition Centre, Dubai, United Arab Emirates, between 24 November and 16 December 2021.

Please read more about the championship here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Chess_Championship_2021

question: Will Joseph Delong announce he’s leaving SushiSwap as CTO before 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joseph Delong, SushiSwap’s CTO, announces that he will either leave SushiSwap or transition to another role prior to January 1, 2022, 12:00 AM ET. 

Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.” 

Please note, if the announcement occurs before the resolution date but it would be in effect after the resolution date, this market will still resolve to “Yes.”

The resolution source for this market will either be a statement made by Delong himself or a publication from an official SushiSwap source. 

In the event of ambiguity, Twitter's user @0xTuba will determine whether or not the resolution criteria have been met.

question: Will Uniswap be live on Polygon before 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether Uniswap will be live on Polygon (Matic) mainnet by the resolution time, January 1, 2022, 12:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Uniswap is deployed and live on the mainnet of Polygon before the resolution time, with or without some bridging mechanism from Ethereum mainnet.

Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

If the resolution criteria are satisfied prior to that date, this market will resolve immediately. “Live” in this context can be defined as being deployed and usable on Polygon and publicly announced via the official Uniswap Twitter and/or blog.

question: Will Sequoia Capital's Youtube memo sell for more than 25 ETH?
description:
This is a market on whether the final sale price for Sequoia Capital’s “Sequoia Capital YouTube Memo”, currently on sale on OpenSea, will be above 25 ETH. 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the sale price is greater than 25.00 ETH, and “No” otherwise. The auction is scheduled to end on December 7. 

In the event the auction is postponed, the resolution of this market will be delayed accordingly. 

If the sale isn’t finalized by December 21, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve to “No”.
